intro: Verbascum litigiosum, commonly known as the silky mullein, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is characterized by its tall, hairy stems and large, heart-shaped leaves that are covered in fine, soft hairs. The plant produces showy yellow flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in dry meadows and rocky habitats. Verbascum litigiosum is a perennial plant that is both ornamental and has historical uses in herbal medicine.
